title: Newtons first law-box with two applied forces

content.question: A box moves with constant speed to the right along a horizontal surface with negligible friction. Two forces, with magnitudes <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, are exerted on the box at angles <math alttext="theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, respectively, as shown. Which of the following is a correct expression for <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> in terms of <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub 1 equals F sub 2, end sub, times open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator the sine of theta sub 2, and denominator the cosine of theta sub 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>sin</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>cos</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub 1 equals F sub 2, end sub, times open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator the cosine of theta sub 2, and denominator the sine of theta sub 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>cos</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub 1 equals F sub 2, end sub, times open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator the sine of theta sub 2, and denominator the sine of theta sub 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>sin</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub 1 equals F sub 2, end sub, times open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator the cosine of theta sub 2, and denominator the cosine of theta sub 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>cos</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>cos</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub 1 equals F sub 2, end sub, times open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator the sine of theta sub 2, and denominator the cosine of theta sub 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>sin</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>cos</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
